result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew E Maccani was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of synthetic cannabinoid [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(em).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs waived.   Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing within 60 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew E Maccani

Defendant Matthew E Maccani in court with attorney Lori A Kuehn.  Defendant Matthew E Maccani in custody.  Patricia J Hanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. Offer has not been tendered.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 16, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  No contact with the co-defendants. The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Matthew E Maccani in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Matthew E Maccani in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
